result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Bernard Burney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
As to the amended charge:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
State has complied with victim rights notification. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Victim is in court and declines to make a statement.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections STRAIGHT TIME with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.
 Conditions of Probation:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with:  Fortino H, Laticia G and Richochet
- Write letter of apology to Fortino H and Laticia G
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
There is no restitution request. Restitution in the amount of zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form
